user.name: Mohammad Mahdi Kheirkhah
user.bio: AI & Quant Programming Enthusiast | Backend Developer | Grit:lab Student

node.name: Multi-Objective-Location-Allocation-NSGA-II
node.description: Optimized model with NSGA-II in Python, tuning hyperparameters via genetic algorithms for efficient real-world crisis mapping.

node.name: bomberman-dom
node.description: This is a full-stack implementation of the classic Bomberman game. The game logic is handled on the backend using Go with structs, methods, and interfaces to follow object-oriented design principles. The frontend, built with JavaScript using our custom mini-framework, communicates live with the backend via WebSocket for real-time gameplay.

node.name: social-network
node.description: A familiar style social network that contains followers, user profiles, groups, events, notifications and chats. Exercise in the 01 edu curriculum.

node.name: buy-01
node.description: Architected and developed a microservices-based e-commerce platform using Java, Spring Boot, and MongoDB on the backend and Angular for the frontend. Implemented Eureka for service discovery, Kafka for asynchronous request handling, and an API Gateway to manage and route traffic.

node.name: real-time-forum
node.description: Upgraded a Go-based forum to feature real-time communication by integrating WebSockets, allowing for live updates without page reloads.
